phrase.item: A fairy tale
Once upon a time there was a hare.
He built a house for himself.
A fox came and said, "Hey hare, open the door for me I am cold."
He said, "I won't open it."
She [the fox] begged him, "Hare, dear hare, open the door for me."
She took the hare out of his house.
He left crying; on the way he met a bear.
He [the bear] said, "Hey hare, why are you crying?"
He replied, "The fox has taken my house."
The bear said, "Let's go."
They continued walking and on the way they met a lamb.
He [the lamb] asked, "Hey hare, why are you crying?"
The bear said, "The fox has taken his house." The lamb said, "Let's go to the whirlwind."
"[We] will complain to him."
He said, "Now let's call the sun-whirlwind."
Then they all went together [to the hare's house].
They knocked at the door.
The whirlwind said, "Hey fox, give the hare's house back to him."
The fox said, "Go away."
Then the sun-whirlwind entered through a hole and chased her, she ran without looking back.
The lamb, hare, and bear got the house and lived there happily.
They thanked the sun-whirlwind and the whirlwind.
